the forms beginning with ''V'' from corresponding forms of {{m|la|vādō}}; the forms beginning with ''F'' from the corresponding forms of {{m|la|sum}}. ===Verb=== {{ast-verb}} # to [[go]] ====Conjugation==== {{ast-conj-dir}} ---- ==Breton== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|br|/diʁ/}} ===Noun=== {{br-noun|m}} # [[steel]] ---- ==Catalan== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|ca|pro|dir}}, from {{inh|ca|la|dīcere}}, present active infinitive of {{m|la|dīcō}}, from {{inh|ca|itc-pro|*deikō}}, from {{inh|ca|ine-pro|*déyḱti||to show, point out}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{ca-IPA}} ===Verb=== {{ca-verb|pres_1_sg=dic}} # {{lb|ca|transitive|intransitive}} to [[say]], to [[pronounce]] # {{lb|ca|transitive}} to [[say]], to [[tell]] #: {{ux|ca|Va dir una mentida.|She told a lie.}} #: {{ux|ca|El dèiem que cuinés el sopar.|We told him to cook dinner.}} # {{lb|ca|transitive}} to [[call]], to [[refer]] to as # {{lb|ca|reflexive}} to be [[name]]d, to be [[call]]ed ====Conjugation==== {{ca-conj-ure-ia2|d|i|infinitive=dir|past_part=dit|impr_2_sg=digues|impr_2_pl=digueu}} ====Alternative forms==== * {{alter|ca|diure||Alghero}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|ca|és a dir}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|ca|dicció}} * {{l|ca|dictar}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:IEC2}} * {{R:GDLC}} * {{R:DNV}} * {{R:DCVB}} ---- ==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{alter|de|Dir}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|dir}}, from {{inh|de|goh|dir}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*þiz}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{qualifier|standard}} {{IPA|de|/diːɐ̯/}} :* {{audio|de|De-dir.ogg|audio}} :* {{rhymes|de|iːɐ̯}} * {{qualifier|colloquially in unstressed position}} {{IPA|de|/dɐ/|/də/}} {{rfc|de|templatize, e.g. with non-gloss}} ===Pronoun=== {{head|de|pronoun form}} # {{lb|de|personal}} {{inflection of|de|du||dat}}; [[you]], to [[you]]. # {{lb|de|reflexive pronoun}} dative; [[yourself]], to [[yourself]]. ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Italian== ===Verb=== {{head|it|verb}} # {{apocopic form of|it|dire}} ---- ==Luxembourgish== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|lb|der}} {{qualifier|unstressed}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|lb|/diːʀ/|[ˈdiː.ɐ]|[diə̯]}} * {{rhymes|lb|iːə}} * {{homophones|lb|dier|Dier|Dir}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{etyl|goh|lb}} {{m|goh|dir}}. ====Pronoun==== {{head|lb|pronoun|cat2=personal pronouns}} # ''second-person singular, dative'': [[you]]; [[thee]] #: {{ux|lb|Ech hunn '''dir''' e Bréif geschéckt.|I have sent '''you''' a letter.}} ===Etymology 2=== From {{etyl|goh|lb}} {{m|goh|ir}}. The ''d-'' is through unetymological segmentation of the ending ''-t'' of a preceding verb (''*stitt ir'' → ''*stiddir'' → ''{{l|lb|stitt}} dir''). This development was assisted by a parallelism with the 1st person, in which the dative singular {{m|lb|mir}} is also the nominative plural (this latter development occurred for a similar reason, but was earlier and is widespread throughout [[High German]]). ====Pronoun==== {{head|lb|pronoun}} # ''second-person plural, nominative'': [[you]]; you all; [[ye]] #: {{ux|lb|Hutt '''dir''' gutt geschlof?|Have '''you''' slept well?}} =====Derived terms===== * {{l|lb|Dir}} {{qualifier|singular and plural polite form}} ===Declension=== {{lb-decl-personal pronouns}} ---- ==Old Occitan== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|pro|dire}} ===Etymology=== From a contraction of {{inh|pro|la|dico|dīcō, dīcere}}. ===Verb=== {{head|pro|verb}} #
